alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 10:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Low lying areas along and on the San Miguel River between mile marker 78 and 93 of Hwy 145 which includes river sections near Sawpit and Placerville. * WHEN...Until 930 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM MST, local law enforcement reported an ice jam within the advisory area. Rapid river rises may cause minor flooding near the advisory area. - It is recommended that anglers stay out of the river within this advisory until further notice. - Homes immediately downstream of the ice jam, which was located approximately one-half mile west of mile marker 78 on Hwy 145, may experience minor flooding of portions of their property if the jam releases instantaneously. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
